DIS Report Status : Unsigned ADMISSION DATE : 07-15-92 08-23-92 PRINCIPAL DIAGNOSIS : Intracerebral hemorrhage . Status post resection of a cerebellar medulloblastoma . HISTORY OF PRESENT ILLNESS : The patient was a 50 year old , right handed , white male with a history of resection of left cerebellar medulloblastoma , resected six years ago and status post chemotherapy and radiation therapy , with a six month history of 30 pound weight loss , who was admitted to the Heaonboburg Linpack Grant Medical Center with a left basilar ganglion hemorrhage . At baseline , he had lived with his guardians , Pandeprob , he was " slow " , walked with a very ataxic gait , did not talk much and spends most of his time watching TV and smoking . He had had several months of increased difficulty swallowing and slurred speech . He had been evaluated by his local medical doctor for his weight loss . He was transferred to the Heaonboburg Linpack Grant Medical Center after being found in the bathroom , on the floor at 8 a.m. , unresponsive . Cerebellar brain carcinoma , status post surgery , chemotherapy and radiation therapy six to seven years ago . He had not had any recurrence . He had history of alcohol abuse in the past . There was no cardiac disease , hypertension or diabetes mellitus . ALLERGIES : MEDICATIONS ON ADMISSION : None . PHYSICAL EXAMINATION : His oropharynx was clear . His skin was clear . The neck was supple without lymphadenopathy . The heart exam revealed a normal Sl and S2 , regular rate and rhythm , no murmur , rub or gallop . The abdomen was soft , nontender , nondistended without hepatosplenomegaly . Pulses were 2+ throughout . The rectal tone was normal with no enlarged prostate , and he was heme positive . Neurologically , he opened his eyes with sternal rub , but not verbalization . He did not have verbal communication and he did not follow verbal commands . His pupils were asymmetric , 6 mm. to 4 mm. on the left , right pupil was 5 mm. reacting to 3 mm. There was no retinopathy . He had a gag and good palpate movement . He lifted his left leg off the bed , but no against resistance . His deep tendon reflexes were noted for symmetric reflexes with upper extremities being 2 and patella 3 . He had clonus bilaterally with up going toe on the right , but not the left . LABORATORY DATA : There was blood in the bilateral posterior horns . On admission , he was difficult to arouse and there was a large volume of heme aspirate per nasogastric tube . Once stabilized , he was transferred to the floor . An magnetic resonance imaging study on 07/17/92 showed a 5.3 x 4 x 4 cm. hematoma involving the basilar ganglion . A repeat computerized tomography scan of the chest I minus on 7/27/92 did not show the mass initially noted . A testicular ultrasound was performed and was negative for mass . There was no specific gastritis and inflammation noted in the bulb and duodenum . An abdominal and pelvic computerized tomography scan was performed and revealed a 7 mm. hypodensity in the lateral left lobe of the liver which was non-enhancing . The GI Service was consulted on this mass and suggested an magnetic resonance imaging study of the liver . Initially , the patient remained drowsy until Decadron was added to his medical regimen . He has slowly made progress with increased strength on the right side and ability to walk with assistance . He was started on Dexedrine because there was a question of whether some component of his lethargy could be depression . This seemed to help him remarkably with increased activity . He still spends a lot of time in bed , although easily arousable . He needs persistent persuasion to increase his activity and was oriented to person , place , but not date . Speech was nonfluent with occasional single words . He followed all commands readily . There was some breakdown in saccads to smooth pursuit . He had limited vertical up gaze . He still had a significant right central facial droop . His gag was intact with palatal movements . Thus , he continued to be nothing by mouth and on tube feeds . He had approximately 4+ to 5/5 strength in the right upper and lower extremities . His left side was full . He had marked dysmetria bilaterally , but left greater than right to finger to nose and his gait was very ataxic . His deep tendon reflexes revealed slight hyper reflexia on the right with 3 right brachial radialis , triceps , biceps and patella . He had right clonus , which was sustained . A head computerized tomography scan was repeated on 08/08/92 which revealed some resolution of blood . At that time , there was no evidence of a mass behind the hematoma . It was felt with his weight loss , that this needs to be relooked at in one month . Thus , he should return to the Heaonboburg Linpack Grant Medical Center to have a repeat head computerized tomography scan in one month to further evaluate a possible mass lesion behind the hematoma .
